Set #76072 Mighty Micros: Iron Man vs. Thanos: The all-powerful Titan and Iron Man duke it out in the Mighty Micros world of LEGO with this first Marvel inspired set from the sub-theme I intend to review. This set features some impressive design choices, but is rather hard to come by these days.
Iron Man: This short-legged version of Tony Stark is wearing armor which is rather similar to his iconic Mark 1 armor from the comics. It&rsquo
column2: s the classic red and yellow colour scheme with very minimal print detailing and the single piece helmet. column1: Thanos: The Titan is rather diminutive in his short-legged form. With a huge victorious grin on his face and some simple design elements evocative of his comic costume he&rsquo
column2: s ready to wipe out half the universe with his cute golden Infinity Gauntlet. Overall a fun little version of the iconic Marvel villain.

column3: ve built so far. This model uses relatively limited parts and seems to be trying to look like a cross between Tony&rsquo
column4: s sports car and his armour. It has four engines mounted on the back, so perhaps this vehicle can fly.

column2: Might Micro is the stand out of the entire set. It is a huge replica of the Infinity Gauntlet in car form. Five 1x1 round tiles in different colours represent the five Infinity Stones and overall this is just a bloody brilliant little vehicle to build and play with.

column1: Thanos is the big seller from this set. Iron Man is nice and all, but could have used more thought in his vehicle design as in comparison to other vehicles in the sub-theme this one is just overall weaker. Overall though I&rsquo
column2: d still recommend picking this set up if you can still find it if only because Thanos and his Mighty Micro is well worth the asking price. Strongly recommended.
